LOL  It's great that I can set several alarms (weekly and once) and have different sounds.  That app is awesome!5) The weather app is great, too--I set several cities where family live (as well as my own city) and it's cook to see the current weather conditions.6) I like the tiles and the fact that I can change the size and which tiles display on my home page.I found the Lock screen annoying so I disabled it now that I am home, but would probably use it when traveling.Sometimes I have to hit the start button several times to engage it.....????  I wish the start button was on the front instead of the side.  However, I do like the button that lets me switch back to the last app I had open.I seem to have issues syncing with my gmail account to update my mail.  Will have to check into that.I purchased this cover i-Blason Asus VivoTab Note 8 Case - i-Folio Slim Hard Shell Stand Case Cover [Life Time Warranty] (Black) which worked really well while traveling, and I like it for setting up the tablet as my alarm clock--it rests at just the right angle, and of course for reading.I'll add more as I use the tablet--thought I am still a Mac fan for sure.

Reviews.Title: Good little tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: Prior to receiving this tablet I had been using an ASUS netbook purchased in 2008 as my Internet machine.This gadget is a vast improvement.I'm not a great fan of the Windows 8 tile interface, but you don't really have to contend with that if you don't want to: just scroll down and you're looking at a nice easy-to-use list of program icons. The stylus takes a bit of getting used to, and utilizing the on-screen keypad is definitely going to slow down the typing speed of anyone accustomed to a regular keyboard, but the really nice wireless speed more than makes up for these disadvantages.Since I'm only going to be using the tablet for Internet browsing, I can't speak to some of the device's more mundane capabilities. I can say that based on its size alone, I would dread trying to work up a spreadsheet or PowerPoint presentation on it--but then I doubt that anyone would buy a tablet with that sort of purpose in mind. I like it better than the iPad I tried out once, for whatever that's worth. (Why should anyone have to log into at least two separate accounts just to browse the Web?)This is a good, sturdy little tablet that I'd recommend to anyone. I think you'll get your money's worth out of it.

Reviews.Title: Whatever you do: Don't lose the adapter to this thing
Reviews.Author: citygal
Reviews.Content: 5/8/2014:  I'm updating the review from below because I recently tried to contact ASUS customer service to order a replacement adapter (my old one was thrown away by accident).  It took me about 40 minutes just to find out which adapter I wouuld need.  First, ASUS has no phone number that you can simply look up and phone them. Instead, if you click on "Contact us" on their web site, you will be directed to a form to input your personal information (name, address, etc. & serial #, model # of product).  Then, you're given three numbers to phone, depending on the type of product you have. Tablets are not listed, so it's a guess as to which number those who own tablets should phone. I guessed incorrectly, so I had to hang up and phone another number. I pressed all the right buttons (I thought), and I was connected . . . and then disconnected.  I phoned again, went through the litany of choices, and finally got a customer service rep.  After telling him my issue, he directed me to the ASUS web site to order the adapter. I told him that I had already tried that and did not know which adapter to order.  He then gave me the E-store phone number to call. I phoned them, and spoke to someone named Monica. She at first told me that they did not have the product but I could probably find it on Amazon. I told her I was on Amazon while speaking with her and wasn't sure which adapter to order. She put me on hold for about 5 minutes and then told me that their E-store did have it.  She gave me the part # to order it. By the way, the adapter is $40 on their e-store, with a minimum of $9 shipping--what a rip off! That adapter weighs next to nothing, yet their charging $9 shipping.  My first customer service experience (see my old review below) must have been a fluke.OLD REVIEW:  This is the first tablet I've ever owned, so you'll need to keep that in mind as you read this review.  It's fast, the screen is a nice size, and the stylus feature works great!  Also, I think it's worth mentioning that the first day, I had a few questions about registering my tablet with Asus, so I called them. The customer service rep was nice, and she answered my question within a few minutes. It means a lot to me that I can actually reach customer service (and I phoned about 10 p.m.) and get my question answered.

Reviews.Title: Just ok
Reviews.Author: tdell
Reviews.Content: I tried this product with hopes it could be paired with the right accessories and replace laptop. It had all the features but the build quality isn't great. Returned it and got the Dell Venue Pro 8. Most specs were identical but the Dell felt more solid, had a better display and came with twice the memory for the same price. Once you buy the Dell proprietary stylus, the price is about the same and the Dell is a better product.

Reviews.Title: don't blame asus too much
Reviews.Author: Ro
Reviews.Content: I rarely leave anything less than a five star review I have never been so disappointed in a purchase before. In the defense of this tablet, it has a lot of potential, especially for the computer savvy.That being said I wish I hadn't bought it, I didn't realize the return policy for electronics from amazon is only thirty days so keep that in mind when buying.When my screen times out, it already won't turn back on unless I power down and turn back on. The connectivity has been an issue but also my internet provider isn't the best so perchance you have top of the line, it might be less of an issue.It seems overall I constantly have to restart this thing just to get it to work, and have ended up using it mostly to stream media rather than all the nice features you're hoping to utilize in the over 400 dollar price tag.I now wish I would have just bought a kindle or other lower priced device because of how little I use it.Like I said though don't blame Asus too much, I'm just sore about not being able to return it and think this sort of purchase might have been wiser to make at Costco where they give you 90 days, I'm hoping maybe it's just operator error because I read so many good reviews on this thing that it seems like there is no way it should be running so poorly.I still wouldn't recommend it because I would hate for someone to have to deal with the same issues I've been having.

Reviews.Title: backspace key is annoying
Reviews.Author: Just Trying to Help
Reviews.Content: It seems like the backspace and the "b" key go off frequently when using the stylus.  I'm not sure why.  So I only give it 3 stars.Overall, I really enjoy using the tablet, its like a full functioned windows computer.  This means I can run Quickbooks Online without running the mobile version when I'm on the road.Battery life is good, touchscreen is good. The stylus has a button on it and works really nicely, the button allows you to have a bit more control with the stylus.  Its a smart stylus, I guess.I think its a good value and I like the fact that you can do anything that a windows computer can do (or at least, I can).  I just can't stand the typing feature, and the backspace key "going off" when the stylus is 3 inches from the keyboard.  I had friends try it and they had the same problem, just to see if it was something I was doing wrong.  The friends had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Love the Stylus, but....
Reviews.Author: Hippie2MARS "Hippie2MARS"
Reviews.Content: I am NOT a Windows 8 fan. I have it on my laptop, so I'm getting more and more used to it, but I still do not enjoy using. The buttons are oddly placed on this tablet. It too me way too long to figure out how to turn the darn thing off! I love the slim profile. Very light and fits comfortably in one's hand. The screen is easy to read without being super bright. The clever built-in space for the stylus is handy, and I'm loving how reactive the screen is to the stylus. Nice touch. Overall though, I'd probably love this device without Windows 8. As it is, especially with the strangely placed buttons, I'm happy with it, but would only give it a resounding "meh".

Reviews.Title: Poor
Reviews.Author: Dr.
Reviews.Content: Regrettably, Asus has manufactured a very poor quality 8" tablet. I returned it, due to continuous problems with the power/wake button and digital pen.
